type.label: Osteolytic defects of the phalanges of the hand

resources.name: An Online Catalog of Human Genes and Genetic Disorders

externalReferences.description: Phenotype and course of Hutchinson-Gilford progeria syndrome

query:
From the following patient information, what is the most likely diagnosis? Use multiple queries or reasoning steps as necessary, and provide a rank-ordered list of up to 10 diagnoses, even if there is insufficient information to make a definitive diagnosis. If you are unsure, provide a list of possible diagnoses with the most likely one first.

Patient ID: 6
Patient age: 5 years
Patient sex: Female
Patient features: Short stature, Elevated diastolic blood pressure, Reduced bone mineral density, Lipodystrophy, Alopecia, Reduced subcutaneous adipose tissue, Hypodontia, Scleroderma, Proptosis, Progressive clavicular acroosteolysis, Osteolytic defects of the phalanges of the hand, Prominent superficial blood vessels, Circumoral cyanosis, Failure to thrive, Micrognathia, Mottled pigmentation, Coxa valga.
Excluded patient features: Ankyloglossia, High palate, Delayed eruption of teeth, Shark teeth, Abnormality of vision.

function.arguments: {"search_terms": ["Short stature", "Elevated diastolic blood pressure", "Reduced bone mineral density", "Lipodystrophy", "Alopecia", "Reduced subcutaneous adipose tissue", "Hypodontia", "Scleroderma", "Proptosis", "Progressive clavicular acroosteolysis", "Osteolytic defects of the phalanges of the hand", "Prominent superficial blood vessels", "Circumoral cyanosis", "Failure to thrive", "Micrognathia", "Mottled pigmentation", "Coxa valga"]}

function.name: search
function.arguments: {"search_terms": ["Ankyloglossia", "High palate", "Delayed eruption of teeth", "Shark teeth", "Abnormality of vision"]}

function.name: run_query
function.arguments:
{"query":"MATCH (d:biolink_Disease)-[:biolink_has_phenotype]->(p:biolink_PhenotypicFeature) WHERE p.id IN [
  'HP:0004322',  // Short stature
  'HP:0005117',  // Elevated diastolic blood pressure
  'HP:0004349',  // Reduced bone mineral density
  'HP:0009125',  // Lipodystrophy
  'HP:0001596',  // Alopecia
  'HP:0003758',  // Reduced subcutaneous adipose tissue
  'HP:0000668',  // Hypodontia
  'HP:0100324',  // Scleroderma
  'HP:0000520',  // Proptosis
  'HP:0000905',  // Progressive clavicular acroosteolysis
  'HP:0009771',  // Osteolytic defects of the phalanges of the hand
  'HP:0007394',  // Prominent superficial blood vessels
  'HP:0032556',  // Circumoral cyanosis
  'HP:0001508',  // Failure to thrive
  'HP:0000347',  // Micrognathia
  'HP:0001070',  // Mottled pigmentation
  'HP:0002673'   // Coxa valga
] RETURN d, count(p) as match_count ORDER BY match_count DESC LIMIT 20"}

messages.content: {'result_as_graph': {'type': 'graph', 'data': {'nodes': [{'data': {'id': 'MONDO:0009557', 'caption': 'mandibuloacral dysplasia with type A lipodystrophy', 'name': 'mandibuloacral dysplasia with type A lipodystrophy', 'description': 'A rare, autosomal recessive inherited disorder caused by mutations in the LMNA gene. It is characterized by growth retardation, craniofacial abnormalities with mandibular hypoplasia, skeletal abnormalities with progressive osteolysis of the distal phalanges and clavicles, and mottled or patchy skin pigmentation. The affected individuals have a marked acral loss of adipose tissue with normal or increased adipose tissue in the neck and trunk.', 'category': 'biolink:Disease', 'label': 'biolink:Disease'}}, {'data': {'id': 'MONDO:0008310', 'caption': 'Hutchinson-Gilford progeria syndrome', 'name': 'Hutchinson-Gilford progeria syndrome', 'description': 'Hutchinson-Gilford progeria syndrome is a rare, fatal, autosomal dominant and premature aging disease, beginning in childhood and characterized by growth reduction, failure to thrive, a typical facial appearance (prominent forehead, protuberant eyes, thin nose with a beaked tip, thin lips, micrognathia and protruding ears) and distinct dermatologic features (generalized alopecia, aged-looking skin, sclerotic and dimpled skin over the abdomen and extremities, prominent cutaneous vasculature, dyspigmentation, nail hypoplasia and loss of subcutaneous fat).', 'category': 'biolink:Disease', 'label': 'biolink:Disease'}}, {'data': {'id': 'MONDO:0009910', 'caption': 'Wiedemann-Rautenstrauch syndrome', 'name': 'Wiedemann-Rautenstrauch syndrome', 'description': 'Wiedemann-Rautenstrauch syndrome is a very rare disorder with features of premature aging recognizable at birth, decreased subcutaneous fat, hypotrichosis, relative macrocephaly and dysmorphism.', 'category': 'biolink:Disease', 'label': 'biolink:Disease'}}, {'data': {'id': 'MONDO:0019321', 'caption': 'atypical Werner syndrome', 'name': 'atypical Werner syndrome', 'description': 'A heterogeneous group of cases that are clinically diagnosed as Werner syndrome (WS) but do not carry WRN gene mutations. Similar to classical WS caused by WRN mutations, patients generally exhibit an aged appearance and common age-related disorders at earlier ages compared to the general population.', 'category': 'biolink:Disease', 'label': 'biolink:Disease'}}, {'data': {'id': 'MONDO:0013523', 'caption': 'Nestor-Guillermo progeria syndrome', 'name': 'Nestor-Guillermo progeria syndrome', 'description': 'A premature aging syndrome, autosomal recessive, characterized by lipoatrophy, osteoporosis, and very severe osteolysis. Patients have no cardiovascular impairment, diabetes mellitus, or hypertriglyceridemia, but suffer profound skeletal abnormalities that affect their quality of life.', 'category': 'biolink:Disease', 'label': 'biolink:Disease'}}, {'data': {'id': 'MONDO:0859147', 'caption': 'Marbach-Rustad progeroid syndrome', 'name': 'Marbach-Rustad progeroid syndrome', 'category': 'biolink:Disease', 'label': 'biolink:Disease'}}, {'data': {'id': 'MONDO:0008389', 'caption': 'autosomal dominant Robinow syndrome', 'name': 'autosomal dominant Robinow syndrome', 'description': 'Autosomal dominant Robinow syndrome (DRS) is the more common type of Robinow syndrome (RS) characterized by mild to moderate limb shortening and abnormalities of the head, face and external genitalia.', 'category': 'biolink:Disease', 'label': 'biolink:Disease'}}, {'data': {'id': 'MONDO:0010650', 'caption': 'Melnick-Needles syndrome', 'name': 'Melnick-Needles syndrome', 'description': 'A otopalatodigital syndrome spectrum disorder and is associated with a short stature, facial dysmorphism, osseous abnormalities involving the majority of the axial and appendicular skeleton resulting in impaired speech and masticatory problems.', 'category': 'biolink:Disease', 'label': 'biolink:Disease'}}, {'data': {'id': 'MONDO:0859177', 'caption': 'VISS syndrome', 'name': 'VISS syndrome', 'category': 'biolink:Disease', 'label': 'biolink:Disease'}}, {'data': {'id': 'MONDO:0012074', 'caption': 'mandibuloacral dysplasia with type B lipodystrophy', 'name': 'mandibuloacral dysplasia with type B lipodystrophy', 'category': 'biolink:Disease', 'label': 'biolink:Disease'}}, {'data': {'id': 'MONDO:0014887', 'caption': 'bone marrow failure syndrome 3', 'name': 'bone marrow failure syndrome 3', 'description': 'Any bone marrow failure syndrome in which the cause of the disease is a mutation in the DNAJC21 gene.', 'category': 'biolink:Disease', 'label': 'biolink:Disease'}}, {'data': {'id': 'MONDO:0012853', 'caption': 'Fontaine progeroid syndrome', 'name': 'Fontaine progeroid syndrome', 'description': 'A rare premature aging syndrome characterized by pre-and postnatal growth retardation, a congenital premature-aged appearance with distinctive craniofacial dysmorphism (wide calvaria with large open anterior fontanel and wide metopic suture, broad forehead, small face, micrognathia), markedly diminished subcutaneous fat, cutis laxa and wrinkled skin, without delay in psychomotor development. Scant, brittle hair, hypoplastic nails and delayed, abnormal dentition, as well as hypoplastic distal phalanges, umbilical hernia and eye abnormalities (myopia/hyperopia, strabismus), are also commonly associated.', 'category': 'biolink:Disease', 'label': 'biolink:Disease'}}, {'data': {'id': 'MONDO:0012637', 'caption': 'COG1-congenital disorder of glycosylation', 'name': 'COG1-congenital disorder of glycosylation', 'description': 'COG1-CDG is an extremely rare form of CDG syndrome characterized clinically in the few cases reported to date by variable signs including microcephaly, growth retardation, psychomotor retardation and facial dysmorphism.', 'category': 'biolink:Disease', 'label': 'biolink:Disease'}}, {'data': {'id': 'MONDO:0010702', 'caption': 'orofaciodigital syndrome I', 'name': 'orofaciodigital syndrome I', 'description': 'A rare neurodevelopmental disorder in the ciliopathy group that is lethal in males and characterized by variable anomalies including external malformations (craniofacial and digital), and possible involvement of the central nervous system (CNS) and of viscera (kidneys, pancreas and ovaries) in females.', 'category': 'biolink:Disease', 'label': 'biolink:Disease'}}, {'data': {'id': 'MONDO:0700107', 'caption': 'chromosome 19q13.11 deletion syndrome, distal', 'name': 'chromosome 19q13.11 deletion syndrome, distal', 'description': 'Chromosome 19q13.11 deletion syndrome in which the distal region was deleted.', 'category': 'biolink:Disease', 'label': 'biolink:Disease'}}, {'data': {'id': 'MONDO:0010026', 'caption': 'SHORT syndrome', 'name': 'SHORT syndrome', 'description': 'SHORT syndrome is a rare inherited condition of multiple anomalies whose name stands for short stature, hyperextensibility of joints, ocular depression, Rieger anomaly and teething delay which, along with mild intrauterine growth restriction, partial lipodystrophy, delayed bone age, hernias and progeroid appearance, are manifestations of the disease.', 'category': 'biolink:Disease', 'label': 'biolink:Disease'}}, {'data': {'id': 'MONDO:0008393', 'caption': 'Rubinstein-Taybi syndrome due to CREBBP mutations', 'name': 'Rubinstein-Taybi syndrome due to CREBBP mutations', 'description': 'Any Rubinstein-Taybi syndrome in which the cause of the disease is a mutation in the CREBBP gene.', 'category': 'biolink:Disease', 'label': 'label': 'biolink:Disease'}}, {'data': {'id': 'MONDO:0008684', 'caption': 'Wolf-Hirschhorn syndrome', 'name': 'Wolf-Hirschhorn syndrome', 'description': 'Wolf-Hirschhorn syndrome (WHS) is a developmental disorder characterized by typical craniofacial features, prenatal and postnatal growth impairment, intellectual disability, severe delayed psychomotor development, seizures, and hypotonia.', 'category': 'biolink:Disease', 'label': 'biolink:Disease'}}, {'data': {'id': 'MONDO:0009999', 'caption': 'autosomal recessive Robinow syndrome', 'name': 'autosomal recessive Robinow syndrome', 'description': 'Autosomal recessive Robinow syndrome (RRS) is the less common type of Robinow syndrome (RS) characterized by short-limb dwarfism, costovertebral segmentation defects and abnormalities of the head, face and external genitalia.', 'category': 'biolink:Disease', 'label': 'biolink:Disease'}}], 'edges': []}}, 'result_as_table': {'type': 'table', 'data': []}}
messages.name: run_query

messages.content:
Based on the patient's features and the diseases most strongly associated with these phenotypes, here is a rank-ordered list of the most likely diagnoses. The ranking is based on the number of matching features and the specificity of the syndromes to the patient's presentation. Each disease is linked to its Monarch Initiative page for further details.

### Most Likely Diagnoses

1. **[Mandibuloacral dysplasia with type A lipodystrophy](https://monarchinitiative.org/MONDO:0009557)**
   - Strongly matches: short stature, lipodystrophy, craniofacial abnormalities (micrognathia), osteolysis of phalanges and clavicles, mottled pigmentation, reduced subcutaneous fat, hypodontia, scleroderma, alopecia, failure to thrive, and more.
   - Description: Rare, autosomal recessive disorder with growth retardation, craniofacial and skeletal abnormalities, and marked loss of adipose tissue.

2. **[Hutchinson-Gilford progeria syndrome](https://monarchinitiative.org/MONDO:0008310)**
   - Matches: short stature, failure to thrive, alopecia, scleroderma-like skin, prominent blood vessels, micrognathia, mottled pigmentation, reduced subcutaneous fat, proptosis.
   - Description: Premature aging syndrome with characteristic facial and skin features, and loss of subcutaneous fat.

3. **[Wiedemann-Rautenstrauch syndrome](https://monarchinitiative.org/MONDO:0009910)**
   - Matches: short stature, reduced subcutaneous fat, hypotrichosis/alopecia, craniofacial dysmorphism, failure to thrive.
   - Description: Neonatal progeroid syndrome with features of premature aging and loss of fat.

4. **[Atypical Werner syndrome](https://monarchinitiative.org/MONDO:0019321)**
   - Matches: progeroid features, short stature, scleroderma, alopecia, lipodystrophy, bone changes.
   - Description: Progeroid syndrome with early-onset aging features, but not classic WRN mutations.

5. **[Nestor-Guillermo progeria syndrome](https://monarchinitiative.org/MONDO:0013523)**
   - Matches: lipoatrophy, osteoporosis, severe osteolysis, skeletal abnormalities, progeroid appearance.
